NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Policy and Patient Satisfaction or the cell corresponding to Research and Staffing?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Research} and {Staffing} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Pharmaceuticals and Prevention or the cell corresponding to Research and Regulations?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Research} and {Regulations} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Insurance and Access or the cell corresponding to Public Health and Cost?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Public Health} and {Cost} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Medical Devices and Epidemiology or the cell corresponding to Hospitals and Outcomes?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Hospitals} and {Outcomes} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.50 to 0.52?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Public Health, Patient Satisfaction), (Public Health, Quality), (Public Health, Staffing)}.
